author: David Hume

core_concepts.definition: We never perceive a necessary connection between cause and effect â€” only constant conjunction.
No logical basis guarantees the future will resemble the past; belief is habit, not reason.
Faint copies of impressions in thought and reasoning.
Primary drivers of belief and expectation.

learning_principles: Be skeptical of claims beyond direct experience.
Understand that reasoning often rests on psychological patterns, not logic.
Recognize the limits of certainty in knowledge.
